definition: rule by virtue/rule by setting virtuous example (Confucian ideal)
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
virtue/goodness/morality/ethics/kindness/favor/character/kind
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: Second, the paper scrutinizes the Confucianists ideas in the way of the Marxism outlook .
sentences.chinese: 第二部分主要是用馬克思主義觀點審視儒家德治思想。

sentences.english: To administer by morals and administer by law are complementary.
sentences.chinese: 德治與法治從來都是相輔相成的，二者缺一不可。

sentences.english: Part Four is about the practice of unifying rule of law and rule of morality.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分談法治與德治統一之實踐論。

sentences.english: There are plentiful the rule of virtue thought in the Confucian tradition.
sentences.chinese: 儒學傳統中有豐富的“德治”思想。

sentences.english: Its core is a virtuous rule.
Ruling the Communist Party of China (CPC) by morality is the internal and reality necessity for the CPC's construction.
sentences.chinese: 以德治黨是黨的建設的內在需要與現實需要。

sentences.english: The concept of "Rule of Virtue" was conceived in Xia and Shang Dynasties and was born in the early westernzhou Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 德治的理念孕育於夏商，誕生在西周初年。

sentences.english: We'd like also to pursue the remarkable future of our company with our respect to the customers and human management .
sentences.chinese: 我們本着以人爲本，尊重客戶，追求卓越，以德治廠。

sentences.english: Confucianist thought of virtue rule is a significant part of the traditional Chinese political ideologies.
sentences.chinese: 儒家德治思想是中國傳統政治思想的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Strengthening administering the country by morals is the inportant guarantee for consolidating the position of our party in power.
sentences.chinese: 加強以德治黨是鞏固我黨執政地位的重要保證。

sentences.english: In our country, " rule of virtue " thought has long history.
sentences.chinese: 在我國，“德治”思想有着悠久的歷史。

definition: benevolent policy/humane government
rule of law/to rule by law
to rule a country
to rule according to the law
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)

Legalist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] and Li Si 李斯[Li3 Si1], later adopted by Shang Yang 商鞅[Shang1 Yang1] whose reforms helped establish the supremacy of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin1 dai4] (221-207 BC)
Confucianism
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
filial piety and fraternal duty
benevolent government
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
(Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
to stress the importance of agriculture (in ancient philosophy)
righteousness/justice

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
